sen.j: 豊国法師（とよくにほうし）の名で知られている。
sen.cmt: クォーテーションマーク変更しました。

sen.j: 『日本書紀』によれば、587年（用明天皇2年）用明天皇が病気となったとき、天皇が仏教に帰依しようと群臣に諮った。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), Emperor Yomei became ill in 587 and wished to become a Buddhist, for which he asked the opinions of his people.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), when Emperor Yomei became ill in 587, he wished to become a Buddhist and asked his subjects' opinions.
sen.cmt: 後半部分を変更し、andの繰り返しを避けるため前半部分もwhenを挿入し変更しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), when Emperor Yomei became ill in 587, he wished to become a Buddhist and asked his subjects' opinions.

sen.j: 賛否両論はあったが、その中で蘇我馬子が賛成したことから、穴穂部皇子に案内されて内裏に入ったのが豊国法師であったという。
sen.e: There were arguments for and against it, but since SOGA no Umako was for the idea and thus Toyokuni was said to be lead into Dairi (Imperial Palace) by Anahobe no Miko.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There were arguments for and against it, but since SOGA no Umako was for it, Toyokuni is said to have been led into Dairi (Imperial Palace) by Anahobe no Miko.
sen.cmt: 繰り返し部分の削除、時制変更、統一性を持たせるためthe ideaをitに変更しました。
